intro: Marsdenia nubicola, commonly known as the Ethiopian Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and woody stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Marsdenia nubicola is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or semi-arid regions.
